decision_title: AI-Assisted Conditional Go — IND Readiness (Non-Clinical Package)
decision_question: Is the current non-clinical evidence package sufficient to proceed with IND submission under explicitly owned conditions, given incomplete long-term stability data and pending final GLP tox report sign-off?

options_considered.description: Proceed with IND submission under conditions (conditional_go).
pros: Maintains IND timeline while explicitly governing known evidence gaps
Conditions create owned closure path with verifiable evidence
cons: Residual risk: limited stability duration at time of filing
Requires disciplined follow-through and post-filing amendment governance
options_considered.estimated_impact: Fastest path to filing while preserving defensibility via explicit conditions and governance controls.

options_considered.description: Defer submission until final GLP tox sign-off and 3-month stability data are available (defer_with_required_evidence).
pros: Reduces residual risk at time of filing
cons: Delays IND timeline and downstream program activities
options_considered.estimated_impact: Higher evidence completeness but delays program milestones.

conditions.condition: Finalize and submit the signed GLP tox report prior to IND filing.
conditions.evidence_to_close: Final signed GLP tox report (controlled version) referenced in evidence registry.

conditions.condition: Submit 3-month stability data amendment within 30 days post-IND filing, with cross-module linkage updated.
conditions.evidence_to_close: 3-month stability dataset + updated Module 2 summaries and CMC tables reflecting the new data.

decision_outcome.rationale_summary: Proceeding is defensible as a conditional_go because core non-clinical adequacy is supported by audited draft evidence, while two known gaps (final GLP tox sign-off and longer-term stability duration) are explicitly governed through owned, time-bound conditions with verifiable closure evidence. AI assistance was used only to support reviewable gap identification and consistency checks; all interpretation, risk acceptance, and final approval remain human-owned.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Audited draft pending final sign-off; acceptable for conditional_go with explicit closure condition.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Summary aligns with non-clinical package; reviewed for consistency with tox margins.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Reviewed for internal consistency across Module 2 narrative references.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Duration limited at time of filing; longer-term data required via post-filing condition.

evidence_items.quality_notes: Adequate for current scope; reviewed for alignment with stability commitments.

gaps.gap: Final signed GLP tox report not yet available at time of decision (audited draft only).
gaps.impact: Audit/filing readiness risk if final sign-off is delayed; requires explicit closure prior to filing.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Condition C1 enforces final signed report delivery and evidence linkage prior to filing.

gaps.gap: Only 1-month stability data available at time of decision; 3-month data pending.
gaps.impact: Residual CMC risk at filing if longer-term stability is expected for the submission strategy.
gaps.mitigation_plan: Condition C2 enforces 3-month stability amendment within 30 days post-filing with cross-module updates.

assumptions.assumption: Audited draft GLP tox report is substantively stable and will not materially change upon final sign-off.
assumptions.risk_if_wrong: Material changes could invalidate rationale and require re-review or escalation.
assumptions.how_to_verify: Compare final signed report to audited draft; record differences and trigger re-review if materially different.

key_risks.risk: Limited stability duration at time of filing may be challenged or require post-filing commitments.
key_risks.mitigation: Explicit condition to deliver 3-month stability amendment and update dependent narratives/tables.

risk_assessment.residual_risk_statement: Residual risk is accepted as bounded and governed, contingent on completion of explicit closure evidence for tox sign-off and stability amendment commitments.

approvals.comments: Approved as conditional_go with explicit conditions and governed closure evidence.

final_signoff.notes: Human accountability confirmed; AI assistance treated as non-authoritative drafting/review support only.

artifacts.description: Cross-document consistency scan for tox margin phrasing and stability linkage across Module 2 narratives.

controls.schema_or_format_constraints: All outputs constrained to RGDS decision-log schema sections; no autonomous actions; no evidence generation.
controls.versioning: Tooling: ChatGPT-style assistant (version not pinned); outputs treated as drafts with mandatory human review.
controls.safety_notes: AI cannot approve decisions, accept risk, or create evidence of record. Outputs must be reviewable, reversible, and source-linked.

actions.description: Deliver final signed GLP tox report and update evidence registry reference for EVID-TOX-001.
actions.success_criteria: Final signed report is stored as a controlled record and linked in the decision evidence registry.

actions.description: Deliver 3-month stability data amendment and update dependent Module 2 narratives/CMC tables.
actions.success_criteria: 3-month stability dataset is stored and all dependent narratives/tables are updated with traceable references.

risk_posture.rationale: Proceeding is acceptable under explicit, owned conditions due to time constraints and sufficient core non-clinical adequacy at decision time.
trade_offs: Accept limited stability duration at filing with controlled post-filing amendment commitment

evidence_completeness.notes: Partial evidence accepted only under explicit closure conditions for tox sign-off and stability amendment.
